revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: To Ptolemaios, Basilikos Grammateus of the Division of Polemon of the Arsinoite nome, discharging also the duties of strategos of the same division, and to Melas, komogrammateus of Ibion Eikosipentarouron, from Herakleides, son of Didymos the younger the son of Herodes, formerly gymnasiarch, Katoikos of the 6475, registered in the Quarter of Tharapeia, in absentia, through his agent, Tyrannos ï¿½ There belongs to Herakleides in the village (?) Ibion Eikosipentarouron one-half portion of a house and courtyard and open-air hall and storage vaults and other appurtenances which I register for the house-by-house registration of the past 16th year of Hadrianus Caesar the Lord, in which no one is registered. (2nd h.) Ptolemaios, Basilikos Grammateus, discharging also the office of strategos. Year 17 of Hadrianus Caesar the Lord, Mesore 11.

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., II.522; SB, XII, no. 10842 Keenan, J.G. Chr.d'Eg. 46 (1971), p. 125 with photo (Fig. 1)
